          performance.mark('gtm.start');
          (function (w, d, s, l, i) {
            w[l] = w[l] || [];
            w[l].push({ 'gtm.start': new Date().getTime(), event: 'gtm.js' });
            var f = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],
                j = d.createElement(s),
                dl = l != 'dataLayer' ? '&l=' + l : '';
            j.async = true;
            j.src = 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id=' + i + dl;
            j.onload = function () {
              performance.mark('gtm.end');
              performance.measure('gtm', 'gtm.start', 'gtm.end');
            };
            f.parentNode.insertBefore(j, f);
        })(window, document, 'script', 'dataLayer', 'GTM-M36RG8PT');

class="metadata Metadata_root__EZem9" data-cy="metadata"><h1 class="Heading_root__KdmZo weight-bold title Metadata_title__aM3nZ">CrowdCasts Monthly: You Have an Adversary Problem</h1><div class="stats Stats_root__p_BoZ"><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC text-secondary weight-regular Text_medium__TH6gG Likes_root__WVQ1_" tabindex="0">6 likes</span><span class="bullet Bullet_root__RBq9k" role="presentation">•</span><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC weight-regular Text_medium__TH6gG Likes_root__WVQ1_" tabindex="0">21,413<!-- --> <!-- -->views</span><button type="button" class="ai-tag unstyled-button AITag_tag__Xx37c" data-cy="ai-tag" aria-describedby="aiTag-description" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rl29r6:" popovertarget=":Rl29r6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rl29r6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:20px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG"><span class="Icon_mask__bniyY" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/sparkles.944c3fba.svg)"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></span>AI-enhanced description</button><div class="" id=":Rl29r6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rl29r6"></div></div><div class="author Author_root___6Bx5"><a class="Link_root__vn3ab Author_link___lVxw ellipsis Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" data-cy="author-link" title="CrowdStrike" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike"><div class="Avatar_root__GNWHY Avatar_size-small__eoiJm"><img class="Avatar_image__Bbtll" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/profile-photo-CrowdStrike-48x48.jpg?cb=1523357406" alt="CrowdStrike, profile picture" decoding="sync"/></div>CrowdStrike</a></div><div class="description Description_root__kt4uq Description_clamped__PaV_1"><div class="Description_wrapper__hYE9_"><p data-cy="document-description">The document discusses adversary problems in cybersecurity, focusing on the identification and categorization of various adversary groups and their activities. It highlights notable adversaries, their motivations, and the tactics they utilize, such as spearphishing and lateral movement, while emphasizing the need for intelligence-driven security. The presentation also includes insights from CrowdStrike experts and encourages organizations to implement adversary-focused security practices.</p><div class="pills-list PillsList_root__2EydN"><a class="Pill_root__IqOYH" aria-label="View the featured presentations, documents and infographics in the Technology Category" href="https://www.slideshare.net/category/technology"><span class="icon class="vertical-player VerticalPlayer_root__K8_YS" data-slideshow-id="27262315"><div><div id="slide1" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-0" alt="You Have an
ADVERSARY PROBLEM.
Who’s Targeting You and Why?

4

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide5" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-4" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversaries are humans
Targeted Attackers:

WHO ARE THE
ADVERSARIES?

Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
They need to get in
They will likely need to move laterally

Spray and Pray (Prey):
They don’t care who they target
(sometimes what)
The more they compromise the
more they win
Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

Adversary Categorization
CATEGORIZATION| Adversary Groups

1

Tactics, Techniques, and Practices

2

Never assume relationships exist
Between indicators

3

Recognize adversaries are constantly changing

4

But RECOGNIZE they are HUMAN

CATEGORIZATION

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-13-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-13-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-13-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-13-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide14" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-13" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Target Sectors: Healthcare, Defense,
Aerospace, Government
Delivery: Likely spearphishing

WHO IS
STONE PANDA?

Malware: Poison Ivy and EvilGrab/
IEChecker
Known Poison Ivy passwords:
menuPass, happyyongzi, Thankss,
Xgstone, keaidestone, and admin

C2 Indicators: fbi.sexxxy.biz;
u1.FartIT.com; jj.mysecondarydns.com;
54.241.13.219; 184.169.176.71;
114.80.96.8

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-15-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-15-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-15-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-15-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide16" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-15" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Relations; Universities

WHO IS
NIGHTSHADE
PANDA?

Delivery: Likely spearphishing
Malware: PlugX and Poison Ivy
Known Poison Ivy passwords: synnia

pu.flowershow.org; tech.network-sec.net;
184.105.178.83; 199.59.243.106;
112.137.162.151

16

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide30" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-29" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY
INTELLIGENCE| Adversary-Centric

1

INTELLIGENCE

Understand the adversaries targeting your
Vertical | Company | Geo-Location | Customers

2

Build appropriate defenses to counter/detect
these adversaries

3

Perform other security practices from an
Adversary-centric perspective
Pen Testing (Red Team)
Security Operations Brieﬁngs
Log Review

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

30

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide31" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-30" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY
INTELLIGENCE| Making it Actionable

1
ACTIONALIZING INTELLIGENCE

Intelligence is diﬃcult to consume
Lots of information to keep straight
New data constantly ﬂowing in (possibly unvetted)

2

Security Operations need to change shis &amp; people

3

Actionable Intelligence

Pass down can’t possibly occur with all indicators

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

31

Problem</h2><div><ul class="Transcript_list__faItj"><div><li>1. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#1">You Have an
ADVERSARY </a> PROBLEM.
Who’s Targeting You and Why?

 </li></div><div><li>2. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#2">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

AGENDA

YOU </a> HAVE AN ADVERSARY PROBLEM.
1. 

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY

2. 

ADVERSARY CATEGORIZATION

ADVERSARY GROUPS - OVERVIEW

4. 

NOTABLE ACTIVITY – Q3

NEW ACTORS

6. 

ACTIONALIZING INTELLIGENCE

2

 </li></div><div><li>3. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#3">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
ADAM MEYERS |
VP, INTELLIGENCE
Recognized speaker, trainer, and intelligence expert with 15+ years
of cyber security industry experience

ranging from wireless, pen testing, IR, and malware analysis

@ADAM_CYBER

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

3

 </li></div><div><li>4. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#4">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
MATT DAHL |
SENIOR ANALYST/ LEGAL COUNSEL
Cyber threat analyst focused on targeted intrusion activity
Focused on investigating indicators of compromise to identify
specific adversary activity
Legal liaison to the CrowdStrike Intelligence Team

@CROWDSTRIKE

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

4

 </li></div><div><li>5. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#5">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversaries </a> are humans
Targeted Attackers:

WHO ARE THE
ADVERSARIES?

Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
They need to get in
They will likely need to move laterally

Spray and Pray (Prey):
They don’t care who they target
(sometimes what)
The more they compromise the
more they win
Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

5

 </li></div><div><li>6. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#6">INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY

2013 CrowdStrike, </a> Inc. All rights reserved.

6

 </li></div><div><li>7. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#7">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversary </a> Categorization
CATEGORIZATION| Adversary Groups

1

Tactics, Techniques, and Practices

2

Never assume relationships exist
Between indicators

3

Recognize adversaries are constantly changing

4

But RECOGNIZE they are HUMAN

CATEGORIZATION

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

7

 </li></div><div><li>8. <a class="Link_root__vn3ab Transcript_link__MLbGS Link_primary__Iq4CI Link_medium__PK_qw" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#8">Intelligence: Adversary Groups

@CROWDSTRIKE </a> | #CROWDCASTS

Understand the adversaries targeting your
Vertical | Company | Geo-Location | Customers

these adversaries

3

Perform other security practices from an
Adversary-centric perspective

New data constantly ﬂowing in (possibly unvetted)

Security Operations need to change shis &amp; people

For a password with two characters, there are 3,844 possible guesses because each character can be one of 62 possible letters, numbers or symbols. Static analysis involves examining a file's code and components without executing it, such as identifying file types, checking hashes, and viewing strings. Dynamic analysis involves executing the malware in a controlled environment and monitoring its behavior and any system changes. Dynamic analysis tools discussed include Process Explorer, Process Monitor, and Autoruns to track malware processes, files accessed, and persistence mechanisms. It presents critical statistics, such as those from the 2024 Verizon Data Breach Report and IBM’s Cost of a Data Breach Report, revealing that 68% of breaches involve human error and 60% of breaches target personal data. From an Indonesian context, it cites BSSN data showing traffic anomalies and malware threats affecting millions, with 83% of companies ignoring official notifications.\n\nIt dissects the threat actor landscape, categorizing them into nation-state hackers, industrial spies, organized crime groups, hacktivists, and terrorists, while outlining their tactics, motivations, and potential impact on critical infrastructure, businesses, and society. The document elaborates on common breach causes—ranging from weak credentials and insider threats to poor configurations—and emphasizes that many incidents are preventable through basic cybersecurity hygiene.\n\nA key portion of the document focuses on the emergence of AI-driven threats, including:\n- Phishing and social engineering enhanced by generative AI\n- AI-generated deepfakes and synthetic media\n- AI CAPTCHA cracking and keystroke logging\n- Voice cloning, brute-force automation, and polymorphic malware\n\nThe presentation maps the evolution of AI—from reactive machines to narrow AI, AGI, and theoretical superintelligence—with a focus on LLMs, RAG, and Agentic AI as current critical enablers and disruptors.
